dead by daylight is a fun idea, with fun gameplay, but the community has decided on two rules that the killers need to abide by in order to make the game fun for everyone. which most, actually, all killers dont follow, with only a small minority of killers opting to try and make the game fun for all.

i love to play as the killer, but recently i tried my shot as survivor and the game works as follows.
if you, the survivor, get hit, you are injured. you get a speed boost but a skilled survivor can lose their persuer if they are careful
another strike from the killer onto the survivor will put them into the dying state if they have not healed or been healed.
once in the dying state the survivors can be picked up and put onto a sacrifical hook. thats the killers main job


the killer need only put a survivor on the hooks three times.
once - they must either wait to be rescued or risk trying to pull themselves off, usually speeding up the sacrifice progress
twice - they must now struggle against a claw, this is the final stretch. if they are not saved soon, they will die and lose the match
third - instant death.
this is a fairly simple and fair system ---- HOWEVER ----- there are NO punishments, nor any seeming ways to stop killers from abusing the LACK of abuse a killer can do to the survivors!

he can put you on the hook and just watch you, make SURE no one can come save you. thats camping.
he can either camp you, or come back in time to see somone save you from the hook, and COMPLETLY ignore the healthy survivor and instead Chase YOU down. thats tunneling - the act of DELIBERATLY targeting one survivor and ignoring the other healthier targets, in favour of simply downing them in one hit and putting them on the hook for a quicker instant kill

as a killer, i love to chase the healthy prey first. if somone was just saved from the hook, i leave them be for a while. let them run out of my sight, doing whatever they wish for a time as i chase their saviour. but it seems that's ONLY me! (again, so far i have played against THREE other killers who also play in a fair and sporting fashion)

so. what do you do? keep letting them attack YOU. down YOU. place YOU onto the hook for more points?
or do you leave, so they dont get as many? well guess what? now you have to wait for the matchmaking to unlock.

yea, you HAVE to let them farm you're sorry ass or else YOU get punished.
as a killer i never encountered this, i played fair, and everyone had a good time. but by gabe newels diary, this is pathetic.

maybe if they can figure out a way to prevent this. perhaps....i dont know. ADD THE OPTION FOR PEOPLE TO VOTE ON THINGS!
somthing like, if you want to vote to leave the match as a group to find a killer that wont abuse this crappy sad pathetic system, you dont get any points. but for gods sake dont PUNISH the survivors. their may be four against one in this case. but you give the killers WAY too much free reign over what they do. this is bull



crackerjacker has started a vote - find new killer, reason: tunneler/camper - 1/5 votes

use the TF2 voting system if you have to. for godes sakes.

just dont get this game UNLESS you want to play as the killers. survivors dont have it easy AT all


p.s if you see a plague killer, there is a 75% chance its me. i love playing plague.

O jogo tem milhares de pontos negativos, mas mesmo assim tem muita gente com muitas horas de jogo. É porque Dead By Daylight é MUITO divertido e MUITO legal. No início, quando tudo é novo, a gente se assusta o tempo todo com o killer vindo. Quando ficamos mais experientes ( NÃO É MEU CASO), é muito divertido fazer o killer desperdiçar o tempo dele te perseguindo enquanto você dá outchase e dribla ele. A comunidade é muitas vezes tóxica, infelizmente, mas sinceramente para mim não senti tanto esse problema, mesmo jogando sozinho. 
É um jogo com infinitas possibilidades de perks/habilidades e estratégias para montar, por isso pra mim não enjoa. O que mais me incomoda é o sistema de rank, pois é muito difícil de upar. Mas fora isso o jogo é bom. Recomendo a todos que se interessam pelo gênero.
no sean killers toxicos, tuneleros, camperos, etc. <3

Before, I played this game so much, and I was always excited for my next round, but now, I can't even play DBD anymore.  After I bought a new monitor, I found that things were so compressed that I could not see anything.  This was the only game that I could not play on the new monitor, and all of the other games in my library were playable.  It took a lot of fiddling with aspect ratios for the game to be even somewhat playable (with a lot of lag), and those changes reset after every round, so it was highly disappointing when I went from playing for hours every week to not playing at all.  

The balancing is pretty messed up, considering how it took so many years to fix a few of the broken hexes and perks that would ruin games for newer players, and even now, there are so many broken perks that it's almost like you can only succeed if you have 1000+ hours, and enough experience to deal with it.  Normally this wouldn't be a problem, if the matchmaking worked, but considering how so many people with iridescent add-ons and purple perks are in the lower ranks, I can safely say, it does not.  At least, not well.

The community can be both the best and worst part of the game, because you'll run into so many toxic and sweaty players that you'll lose hope in humanity.  Though, once in a while, you'll find some respectable players that can make games enjoyable, but alas, they are a dime in a dozen, since I've only encountered five or six across something like 50 or 60 games.  Most of the time, you'll come across SWF groups that only help people in their own group, players that would do everything in their power to save themselves and screw over their team, or players so boosted that they don't even deserve rank 20 (the lowest in the game).

Maybe after a few updates, when it becomes more playable, I will be able to pick it up again, but at this point I've completely lost interest.  If you're looking for a game to play on your own, I do not recommend it unless you have the patience of a saint.  If you plan on playing it with friends, I would suggest getting 5 people total, so you could play customs, and not deal with the public lobbies.

Если не считать поразительных хитбоксов, мистическим образом проходящих сквозь стены; если забыть о гениальных тактиках манов, которые не брезгуют пользоваться такими мерзостями, как кемперство и тунеллерство; если на секунду сделать вид, что Гнилое Болото не состоит на 80% из непроходимых дорожек и забагованных тупиков; и если, конечно же, найти весёлую, абсолютно неадекватную [потому что, ну, кто в здравом уме будет играть в эту игру?] компанию - вам грозит море впечатлений. Нет, серьёзно. Не ставьте целью поднятие рангов. Не расстраивайтесь, если не получается сбежать. И, богом прошу, никогда не выбирайте тактику кемпера или тунеллера. Просто отдыхайте. Токсичьте, развлекайтесь, кричите - да что угодно! Это хорошая игра. Правда хорошая. Но только в том случае, если есть, с кем её разделить.

Хотел написать отзыв еще в том году, но руки все не доходили; после выхода обновления тоже решил подождать, присмотреться, но мое мнение об игре не изменилось: не для кого не секрет, что дбд — хранилище багов, которые никто не спешит фиксить. Начиная от багов с тотемами, которые невозможно очистить, заканчивая Болотом, где каждый раз думаешь: «Пробегу через текстуру или врежусь в невидимую стену?». По большей части, если откинуть большинство неприятных моментов и основательно засесть в игре с друзьями, то впечатление сглаживается. Классическая игра для компании, где понимаешь, что спасение утопающего — дело рук самого утопающего.
Ахуетельная игра, честно говоря, пока тебя не шамарнёт топором маньяк.
